channel.title: guides on Nyrs' garden
channel.description: Recent content in guides on Nyrs' garden

item.title: Contributing to open source projects with git
item.description: This is a step by step guide on how to contribute to open source projects with git. It also acts as a cheatsheet for me as I always forget how to do it. Before telling you how you can contribute, I will tell you why you should even consider it. Why you should consider contributing to open source projects By contributing to public open source projects you can gain a lot of real-world experiencce and skills.

item.title: Set up your website on the tor network
item.description: Setting up your own website on the Tor network has many benefits, one of them being that you only need a server and no domain name to set it up. Another benefit is the privacy provided by .onion domains and the Tor network in general. Most registrars publish your personal information, which can be viewed on the public WHOIS database, for everyone to view and access. Furthermore, it is very easy to set up if you already have a clearnet website like mine.

item.title: How to generate a customized .onion address
item.description: After following this guide you should have a working tor .onion site. This .onion domain will be generated randomly and most likely won’t have anything to do with the actual domain name of your clearnet site. To changes this you can use a tool called mkp224o to generate a vanity tor onion v3 address. This guide will be for Debian users but it’s pretty easy to do it on any other os, you just have to know the name of the packages in the repos of you distro and change the command a little bit to fit your package manager.
